doc:
Winston Miller https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Winston_Miller 0 Winston Miller (June 22, 1910 – June 21, 1994) was an American screenwriter, film producer, and actor. He wrote for 62 films and television shows between 1936 and 1976. He began as an actor in silent films, appearing in eleven films between 1922 and 1929. He was the screenwriter for many TV series including Wagon Train Episode 13, Season 1 in 1957: "The Clara Beauchamp Story" with Nina Foch and Shepperd Strudwick. Earl Bellamy was the director. He was born in St. Louis, Missouri, the younger brother of silent film star Patsy Ruth Miller. He died in Los Angeles from a heart attack. Winston_Miller ( June_22_,_1910 – June_21_,_1994 ) was an_American_screenwriter , film_producer , and actor . He wrote for 62_films_and_television_shows between 1936_and_1976 . He began as an_actor in silent_films , appearing in eleven_films between 1922_and_1929 . He was the_screenwriter for many_TV_series including Wagon_Train_Episode_13 , Season_1 in 1957 : " The_Clara_Beauchamp_Story " with Nina_Foch and Shepperd_Strudwick . Earl_Bellamy was the_director . He was_born in St._Louis , Missouri , the_younger_brother of silent_film_star_Patsy_Ruth_Miller . He died in Los_Angeles from a_heart_attack .
